Children sleep less .As pediatric sleep specialists and board members for the
American Academy of Sleep Medicine and the Society of Behavioral Sleep
Medicine, we feel compelled to point out that the critical tone of this article
is misleading and over-simplified. While there is still much we need to learn, pediatric sleep
investigators have performed a significant number of rigorous studies to help
address the issue of optimal sleep duration for children. Research has helped
us establish the most appropriate range for total daily sleep time at each
stage of normal childhood development. These recommendations are used by
physicians who encounter pediatric patients with Sleep problems, and they
provide standard guidance for parents who are often concerned about their
childâ€™s sleep.Â Moreover, these guidelines on the recommended number of
hours of sleep are Always given in the context of other clues that parents can
use to determine whether their child is getting sufficient sleep.Â For example, well-rested children should wake spontaneously in the morning and should not require additional sleep on weekends and during school vacations.Â I thank you Firozali A.Mulla DBA
